result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Dewayne Harris Jr

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Matter is rescheduled due to the 14-day statutory time frames. Parties notified. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris Jr in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Anthony Dewayne Harris Jr.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Return on Doctor's report. Defendant is still in custody at the CJF, has not been transported to DHS. Defense to file a FORTHWITH order to get defendant transported. Court adjourns matter for a review hearing in Branch 11.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

AMENDED Order of Commitment for Treatment

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

No parties present in court.
Case was not scheduled before Branch 28 on today's date.
Case called on the case along with Case# 22CF01069 to clarify Court's order.

On May 25, 2022 as to Case# 22CF01069:
Court ordered defendant committed for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  
Case# 22CF01069 was adjourned for return on doctor's report on 8/30/2022 in Branch 11.

On May 25, 2022 as to Case# 22CF01056:
Court adopted the findings of as to the competency hearing held on Case# 22CF01069.

Order of Commitment should have been prepared to include both cases.
Amended Order of Commitment for Treatment to be forwarded to the Court for Judge's signature.

Clerk:  jms

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Court adopts findings in Case Number 22CF1069. Defendant is not competent. Case adjourned for Return on Doctor Report. 
  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 28.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Dewayne Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of MKE Police Officer Jonathan Schroeder. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  24 hour curfew with the exception of court appearances. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $6,500.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TMH or TLN

Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in court with Student Intern Colin Nicholson under the supervision of attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Anthony Dewayne Harris in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Dewayne Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
